title: Optical Component Platform Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for invention and self-challenge? Do you thrive on pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Display Technologies group, you’ll help ensure our products’ displays work beautifully through the successful design, fabrication, and implementation of components in Apple devices. From initial concept to mass production, you’ll develop highly innovative displays for the full line of Apple products, including Apple Watch, iPhone, iPad, and Mac. Through touch and sight, these displays are how millions of Apple customers connect with our products every single day. Together, you’ll collaborate with multifunctional teams across Apple to make each interaction a magical experience to see and touch.
description: We are seeking an experienced, hardworking engineer to support the design and integration of Apple’s products by leading the investigation of sophisticated optical and electro-optical components inside the Vision Pro system, camera, display optics and sensing modules. You will work with both suppliers and cross-functional teams at Apple to craft the technologies that go into our outstanding products.
key_qualifications: Robust understanding and technical background in optics, physics and material science. BS and a minimum of 10 years relevant industry experience in Optics, Material Science, Physics, Chemistry or equivalent. Experience in geometric or diffractive optical component design, process and integration into optical module. Experience with nano-optics manufacturing process including deposition, lithography, nano-imprint, etching etc. Knowledge and experience of thin film or nanostructure optical design and modeling, process and characterization. Advanced cross-functional coordination and team management. Ability to travel 10% of the time, domestic and internationally.
preferred_qualifications: Hands-on experience and proven track record in areas relating to optics, optical coating or advanced semiconductor process technology development. Experience with diffraction optics, metasurface optics or silicon-photonics. Experience with simulation software for optical, FEA or Multiphysics , such as COMSOL
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $175,800 and $312,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
